[COUNTRY=India | CURRENCY=INR | REGULATOR=RBI | SOURCE=India_Stable_Assets__SGB.md]
[TOPICS: eligibility, gold, liquidity, tenure]

| Category                                   | Provision / Rule                                                            |
|--------------------------------------------|-----------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| Instrument Name                            | Sovereign Gold Bond (SGB)                                                   |
| Nature of Instrument                       | Government security denominated in grams of gold                            |
| Issuer                                     | Government of India                                                         |
| Issuing Authority                          | Reserve Bank of India (RBI) on behalf of Government of India                |
| Form of Holding                            | RBI books (certificate of holding) or Demat form                            |
| Purpose                                    | Substitute for holding physical gold                                        |
| Mode of Investment                         | Cash payment at issue price                                                 |
| Mode of Redemption                         | Cash (Indian Rupees)                                                        |
| Eligible Investors                         | Persons resident in India under FEMA, 1999                                  |
| Eligible Categories                        | Individuals, HUFs, Trusts, Universities, Charitable Institutions            |
| Status Change (Resident to Non-Resident)   | Allowed to continue holding till early redemption/maturity                  |
| Joint Holding                              | Permitted                                                                   |

[COUNTRY=India | CURRENCY=INR | REGULATOR=RBI | SOURCE=India_Stable_Assets__SGB.md]
[TOPICS: eligibility, gold, tenure]

| Category                                   | Provision / Rule                                                            |
|--------------------------------------------|-----------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| Investment by Minor                        | Permitted through guardian                                                  |
| Application Sources                        | Banks, SHCIL, Post Offices, designated agents, RBI website                  |
| Online Application                         | Permitted through scheduled commercial banks                                |
| KYC Requirement                            | PAN mandatory                                                               |
| Investor ID                                | One unique Investor ID per investor                                         |
| Denomination                               | 1 gram of gold and multiples thereof                                        |
| Minimum Investment                         | 1 gram                                                                      |
| Maximum Investment (Individuals)           | 4 kg per fiscal year                                                        |
| Maximum Investment (HUF)                   | 4 kg per fiscal year                                                        |
| Maximum Investment (Trusts & Institutions) | 20 kg per fiscal year                                                       |
| Joint Holding Limit                        | Applies to first applicant                                                  |
| Fiscal Year Definition                     | April – March                                                               |

[COUNTRY=India | CURRENCY=INR | REGULATOR=RBI | SOURCE=India_Stable_Assets__SGB.md]
[TOPICS: gold, interest_rate, liquidity, risk, tenure]

| Category                                   | Provision / Rule                                                            |
|--------------------------------------------|-----------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| Secondary Market Purchases                 | Included in annual ceiling                                                  |
| Collateral Holdings by Banks               | Excluded from ceiling                                                       |
| Interest Rate                              | 2.50% per annum (fixed)                                                     |
| Interest Payment Frequency                 | Semi-annual                                                                 |
| Interest Recipient                         | Credited to investor’s bank account                                         |
| Interest on Maturity                       | Payable along with principal                                                |
| Issue Price Determination                  | Average closing price of 999 purity gold (IBJA) for last 3 business days    |
| Online Discount                            | ₹50 per gram discount for online + digital payment                          |
| Gold Price Publication                     | Published on RBI website two days before issue opens                        |
| Redemption Price Basis                     | Average closing price of 999 purity gold for preceding 3 business days      |
| Redemption on Maturity                     | In Indian Rupees                                                            |
| Tenor                                      | 8 years                                                                     |

[COUNTRY=India | CURRENCY=INR | REGULATOR=RBI | SOURCE=India_Stable_Assets__SGB.md]
[TOPICS: eligibility, gold, interest_rate, liquidity, tax, tenure]

| Category                                   | Provision / Rule                                                            |
|--------------------------------------------|-----------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| Premature Redemption                       | Allowed after 5 years on coupon payment dates                               |
| Tradability                                | Tradable on stock exchanges if held in demat form                           |
| Transferability                            | Permitted to eligible investors                                             |
| Exit via Premature Redemption              | Application 30 days before coupon date                                      |
| Gift / Transfer                            | Allowed under Government Securities Act, 2006                               |
| Use as Collateral                          | Permitted for loans                                                         |
| Loan-to-Value Ratio                        | Same as ordinary gold loans prescribed by RBI                               |
| Decision on Loan Grant                     | At discretion of bank / financing agency                                    |
| Tax on Interest                            | Taxable under Income-tax Act, 1961                                          |
| Capital Gains on Redemption (Individuals)  | Exempt                                                                      |
| Indexation Benefit                         | Available on long-term capital gains on transfer                            |
| TDS Applicability                          | Not applicable                                                              |

[COUNTRY=India | CURRENCY=INR | REGULATOR=RBI | SOURCE=India_Stable_Assets__SGB.md]
[TOPICS: eligibility, liquidity, tenure]

| Category                                   | Provision / Rule                                                            |
|--------------------------------------------|-----------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| Nomination Facility                        | Available                                                                   |
| Nominee NRI Provision                      | Allowed with non-repatriable proceeds                                       |
| Dematerialisation                          | Available at application or later                                           |
| Trading Requirement                        | Only demat-held bonds tradable                                              |
| Partial Transfer / Redemption              | Allowed in multiples of 1 gram                                              |
| Payment Modes                              | Cash (≤ ₹20,000), cheque, DD, electronic transfer                           |
| Allotment Assurance                        | Subject to eligibility, KYC, and timely payment                             |
| Certificate of Holding                     | Issued on date of issuance                                                  |
| Customer Service Providers                 | Issuing banks, SHCIL, Post Offices, Stock Exchanges                         |
| Services Covered                           | Address change, redemption, nomination, transfer, grievances                |
| Redemption Intimation                      | Investor informed one month before maturity                                 |
| Death of Investor                          | Nominee / legal heir claim as per Govt. Securities Act                      |
